title: 'Biden does not blink': Doctors reply to viral X post
content: Biden was seen faltering during the debate, speaking rapidly in a raspy, trailing-off voice. His voice was noticeably hoarse. In February, White House published Biden's health report and said he was responding well to the treatment for sleep apnea. "President Biden is a healthy, active, robust 81-year-old male who remains fit to successfully execute the duties of the Presidency," according to the report.
summary: Biden was seen faltering during the debate, speaking rapidly in a raspy, trailing-off voice. His voice was noticeably hoarse. In February, White House published Biden's health report and said he was responding well to the treatment for sleep apnea. "President Biden is a healthy, active, robust 81-year-old male who remains fit to successfully execute the duties of the Presidency," according to the report.

title: Panicked Democrats call for Joe Biden to stand down after debate debacle
content: The Democratic Party in the United States is grappling with the fallout from Thursday night's Presidential debate, which saw their likely nominee, Joe Biden, experience multiple lapses in concentration, including a mental block that quickly became a viral gif. The former Vice President's showing has left many Democrats deeply concerned about his ability to effectively challenge the incumbent, Donald Trump, in the upcoming election. In light of Biden's lackluster performance, some within the Democratic Party are now suggesting that he should withdraw from the race.
summary: The Democratic Party in the United States is grappling with the fallout from Thursday night's Presidential debate, which saw their likely nominee, Joe Biden, experience multiple lapses in concentration, including a mental block that quickly became a viral gif. The former Vice President's showing has left many Democrats deeply concerned about his ability to effectively challenge the incumbent, Donald Trump, in the upcoming election. In light of Biden's lackluster performance, some within the Democratic Party are now suggesting that he should withdraw from the race.

title: Putin was fast asleep when Biden, Trump shouted his name
content: It was 4 am in Moscow when Joe Biden and Donald Trump were screaming his name in the first US presidential debate Thursday. Kremlin said Putin did not watch the debate live as it is not a main event for Russia. The president was not expected to set an alarm and wake up at 4 am to watch the debate, a spokesperson said.
summary: It was 4 am in Moscow when Joe Biden and Donald Trump were screaming his name in the first US presidential debate Thursday. Kremlin said Putin did not watch the debate live as it is not a main event for Russia. The president was not expected to set an alarm and wake up at 4 am to watch the debate, a spokesperson said.

title: South African researchers test use of nuclear technology to curb rhino poaching
Biden not dropping out, will return to debate in September
content: As Biden faced Trump for the first presidential debate on CNN, panic spread in his party because of Biden's lackluster debate punctuated by stumbles, pauses, freezing moments. Democrats questioned in public and private whether the party could or should replace him as the party's presidential nominee. Former Obama campaign aide Ravi Gupta said it was a blessing that the debate was in June and not September but only if the party does something before September debate.
summary: As Biden faced Trump for the first presidential debate on CNN, panic spread in his party because of Biden's lackluster debate punctuated by stumbles, pauses, freezing moments. Democrats questioned in public and private whether the party could or should replace him as the party's presidential nominee. Former Obama campaign aide Ravi Gupta said it was a blessing that the debate was in June and not September but only if the party does something before September debate.

title: NYT columnist, Joe Biden's friend, says he wept watching debate: 'He must bow out'
content: NYT columnist Thomas L Friedman wrote with a heavy heart that it is now time for Joe Biden to bow out of the contest with dignity. Friedman said Biden has been his friend since 9/11 when they travelled together to Pakistan and Afghanistan. So far, Friedman was ready to give Biden the benefit of doubt but not after the CNN face-off. Friedman wrote he wept after watching the debate.
summary: NYT columnist Thomas L Friedman wrote with a heavy heart that it is now time for Joe Biden to bow out of the contest with dignity. Friedman said Biden has been his friend since 9/11 when they travelled together to Pakistan and Afghanistan. So far, Friedman was ready to give Biden the benefit of doubt but not after the CNN face-off. Friedman wrote he wept after watching the debate.

title: Canada minister on 'rescue Afghan Sikhs first' row: 'Because of my turban'
content: Under fire for allegedly prioritizing Afghan Sikhs during the Canada government's rescue operation in Kabul, minister Harjit Sajjan said he did not order it, he only relayed information provided by an NGO to the armed forces. The minister said there were no preferences given to Afghan Sikhs during the rescue operation as the aim was to get as many people out of Kabul as possible but he is facing flak only because he is a Sikh.
summary: Under fire for allegedly prioritizing Afghan Sikhs during the Canada government's rescue operation in Kabul, minister Harjit Sajjan said he did not order it, he only relayed information provided by an NGO to the armed forces. The minister said there were no preferences given to Afghan Sikhs during the rescue operation as the aim was to get as many people out of Kabul as possible but he is facing flak only because he is a Sikh.

title: China is ‘killing us as a country’ under Joe Biden, Donald Trump claims
content: During the first debate ahead of November's presidential election, Donald Trump accused China of "killing" the US and alleged that Joe Biden was leading the country towards a world war. Trump criticized Biden's handling of China, claiming, "China is going to own us if you keep allowing them to do what they’re doing to us as a country." He further criticized Biden's military policies as "insane," asserting that leaders like China's Xi Jinping, Russia's Vladimir Putin, and North Korea's Kim Jong Un do not respect or fear Biden.
summary: During the first debate ahead of November's presidential election, Donald Trump accused China of "killing" the US and alleged that Joe Biden was leading the country towards a world war. Trump criticized Biden's handling of China, claiming, "China is going to own us if you keep allowing them to do what they’re doing to us as a country." He further criticized Biden's military policies as "insane," asserting that leaders like China's Xi Jinping, Russia's Vladimir Putin, and North Korea's Kim Jong Un do not respect or fear Biden.

title: ‘Brain-dead performance’: Vivek Ramaswamy’s swipe at Biden after presidential debate
French parties in final push for votes ahead of crunch poll
content: France's political forces are making a final push for votes in crucial legislative elections that may result in the far right taking government control for the first time. The official campaigning period ends at midnight on Friday, followed by a day off from political activity on Saturday, in preparation for voting on Sunday. A second round of campaigning will continue until the decisive vote on July 7.
summary: France's political forces are making a final push for votes in crucial legislative elections that may result in the far right taking government control for the first time. The official campaigning period ends at midnight on Friday, followed by a day off from political activity on Saturday, in preparation for voting on Sunday. A second round of campaigning will continue until the decisive vote on July 7.

title: 'Deception': South Korea debunks North Korean missile success with video evidence
content: The South Korean military released video footage showing a North Korean missile spiralling and exploding, countering North Korea's claim of a successful test. The missile's failure, attributed to flight instability, was captured by a thermal observation device. South Korea accused North Korea of exaggerating the test's success, disputing Pyongyang's reports of advancements in missile technology.
summary: The South Korean military released video footage showing a North Korean missile spiralling and exploding, countering North Korea's claim of a successful test. The missile's failure, attributed to flight instability, was captured by a thermal observation device. South Korea accused North Korea of exaggerating the test's success, disputing Pyongyang's reports of advancements in missile technology.

title: Iran Presidential elections: Who are the candidates? Other details
content: The ongoing Iranian presidential election features diverse candidates, including hardliners and moderates. The Guardian Council, a stringent panel consisting of clerics and jurists under the supervision of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who holds the ultimate authority in all state affairs, screened over 80 aspiring candidates including 4 women and only six were filtered out through the rigorous selection process. Following the Guardian Council's approval of six candidates for the 2024 election, two contenders who withdrew from the race.
summary: The ongoing Iranian presidential election features diverse candidates, including hardliners and moderates. The Guardian Council, a stringent panel consisting of clerics and jurists under the supervision of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who holds the ultimate authority in all state affairs, screened over 80 aspiring candidates  including 4 women and only six were filtered out through the rigorous selection process. Following the Guardian Council's approval of six candidates for the 2024 election, two contenders who withdrew from the race.

title: 'The Real Debate': Independent candidates Robert F Kennedy Jr holds debate by himself after CNN snub
'Self-coup': Was military uprising a hoax in Bolivia?
content: Bolivian President Luis Arce on Thursday denied any involvement or prior knowledge of a failed coup attempt led by the country's former top military commander who alleged the president had asked him to do something to boost his popularity. "We were never informed about his intentions," Arce told reporters during a press conference at government headquarters. "We were surprised."
summary: Bolivian President Luis Arce on Thursday denied any involvement or prior knowledge of a failed coup attempt led by the country's former top military commander who alleged the president had asked him to do something to boost his popularity. "We were never informed about his intentions," Arce told reporters during a press conference at government headquarters. "We were surprised."

title: Taiwan warns against travel to China, Hong Kong, and Macao amid execution threats
China's Xi calls for 'bridges' amid trade, diplomatic frictions
How mute button will work at tonight's Biden-Trump debate
content: Behind the podiums, there will be two green lights which are a signal for the microphones. When the lights are off, the microphone is mute. When a candidate speaks, the microphone of the other remains off and at that time if the second one interrupts the first one, his voice will not reach the viewers -- he will only be seen miming. But as they are be standing at lecterns that are only 8 feet apart, they will hear each other, even if on mute.
summary: Behind the podiums, there will be two green lights which are a signal for the microphones. When the lights are off, the microphone is mute. When a candidate speaks, the microphone of the other remains off and at that time if the second one interrupts the first one, his voice will not reach the viewers -- he will only be seen miming. But as they are be standing at lecterns that are only 8 feet apart, they will hear each other, even if on mute.
